page.title: 06HEALTH IN WALSALL
page.content: The two hospitals in Walsall are{The {General}and{The Manor.}About 52 people are admitted to hospital daily. Each week 120 people are treated for accidents involving cars. 6% of the weekly intake are the elderly, the majority having suffered strokes.{The {Manor}has 29 wards, 4 of which are for the elderly. On average,{55 babies}are born each week. {Walsall Health Authority}employs{4200 people. It costs{Â£17,000,000}a year to run one hospital. An extension is being built onto{The Manor}which should be completed by 1988. A statue of{Sister Dora,}the first nurse in charge of{The General}can be seen in the{town centre. Statistics for 1983 show Walsall to be one of the unhealthiest places to live in the West Midlands.
